introduction: You found some pills in your medicine cabinet that look like tamsulosin. You do not remember who was taking these pills and why. You are looking for indications for tamsulosin.
question: What is tamsulosin used for?

answers.text: Tamsulosin is mostly used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH, a condition in men in which the prostate gland is enlarged),  and the overactive bladder (OAB) and lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) linked to prostate inflammation and BPH.
It is also used to treat ureteral stones (a stone in the urinary tract) and pain caused by these stones (renal colic).
